title: Ladies of the Cove
description: Needing to relax after a week of class and murder, the Detective went to a sleepy little seaside town. Unfortunately, the kind of rest that people seem to get here is less "a good night's" and more "in peace". So it was back to the old murder board for the Detective.

personList.name: Ms. Archer
personList.description: A widow with a penchant for murder mysteries. Some people wonder if she's been acting out her books in real life.
personList.statement: I was writing my latest book at the time of the murder.

personList.name: Ms. Poppy
personList.description: A fan of murder mystery stories. Hopefully she's not the type to make one of her own.

personList.name: Mrs. Curls
personList.description: A hair salon owner and wife of a clown. That's how she describes him at least. He's at least got great hair.
personList.statement: I saw Ms. Archer at City Hall.

weaponList.name: Typewriter
weaponList.description: A charming if outdated piece of hardware.

weaponList.name: Shears
weaponList.description: Shiny and sharp. Hope they stay just the right distance from your neck.

locationList.name: Bookstore
locationList.description: It's known for a lot of murder stories. Usually fictional though.

locationList.name: Salon
locationList.description: The best place to learn about all the town's secrets. Maybe some of them should have stayed secret.

locationList.name: City Hall
locationList.description: A place of law. Whether upholding or breaking it is up to the people there.

clueList: The Shears were held in a right hand.
A blonde hair was found at the bookstore.

resolution.resolutionText: Ms. Poppy smiled. Then she started laughing. She cackled until she ran out of breath before catching it and fixing the Detective with a sadistic smile. "Happy sluething," she said. The detective felt mildly threatened and decided to not stay in the town long. Let the boys in blue handle the paperwork.
